授業目的:
The objective of this course is for the student to understand the fundamental theory of finance. We will discuss how financial managers face two decisions- which real assets the firm should invest in and how to raise the cash to pay for them. Thus, the investment decision typically precedes the financial decision. This course will be devoted to different aspects of the investment decision. The first topic is how to value real and financial assets. The second topic is the link between the risk and value, and the third is the management of the capital investment process.
Along with the discussion on corporate asset, capital acquisitions and management, the course also deals with the issues related to agency problems and managerial incentives which might affect the value of a firm. This course will be facilitated by lectures, case discussions and exercises.
到達目標: Students will understand the theory of corporate finance to solve financial problems at companies.  Students will be able to discuss how financial managers face two decisions- which real assets the firm should invest in and how to raise the cash to pay for them.  Students will also be able to value real and financial assets, applying the link between the risk and returns, and to manage the capital investment process.
授業方法: For the first two weeks, we provide the course online by Zoom.  After that, we will do face-to-face along with online by Zoom.
